definition: to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off

sentences.english: See what they spew from their mouths- they spew out swords from their lips, and they say, 'Who can hear us?'
sentences.chinese: 他們口中噴吐惡言，嘴裏有刀，他們說有誰聽見。

sentences.english: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
sentences.chinese: 他們口中噴吐惡言，嘴裏有刀，他們說有誰聽見。

sentences.english: I can't bear to use harsh words against people.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我的心太軟，所以我不忍心對人惡言相向。

sentences.english: Enduring verbal abuse is also a kind of spiritual practice.
sentences.chinese: 面對惡言惡語，也是一種修行。

sentences.english: Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
sentences.chinese: 你口任說惡言，你舌編造詭詐。

sentences.english: But the talks are occurring in an atmosphere of mutual suspicion, in which confrontational invective is growing.
sentences.chinese: 但談判在相互猜疑的氣氛中開始，對峙的惡言在增加。

sentences.english: Do not describe other people with critical words, say nothing of quarrel .
sentences.chinese: 不要用批評的語言說別人，更不要惡言相向。

sentences.english: Respond to the content of your boss's tirade, not the curses.
sentences.chinese: 只可迴應你老闆所責罵的事，而不迴應他的惡言惡語。

sentences.english: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
sentences.chinese: 就要禁止舌頭不出惡言，嘴脣不說詭詐的話。

sentences.english: It is a good tongue that says no ill, and a better heart that thinks none.
sentences.chinese: 再幹淨的嘴也會吐惡言，再善良的心也會想壞事。

sentences.english: He wasn't disturbed by the wicked words.
sentences.chinese: 他沒受那些惡言惡語的干擾。
現在卻要付出辛苦勞作，忍受惡言相向。

definition: harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to pay back a score/to get revenge/to requite/(old) variant of 抱怨[bao4 yuan4]
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
